column4: I am running an XP virtual machine in VMware Workstation, the VM doesnt recognize the chipset/VGA/SCSI
does the VM run in low-res mode?
nope, i can run it in anything
can or can't? if it runs but looks lousy, did you install the tools?
without the tools installed, resolution will be poor and performance will be awful.
so XP comes up in the vm, but display is poor, right?
nope display is nice, everything is pretty sweet except that the mouse is jittery
yep, that's sign #1 you need the tools!
you should see marked improvement once installed. also, will you be installing Win2K3 Server?
nope, I just need an XP VM to run Adobe CS3 in
because i guess CS3 is a no go in ubuntu
BE SURE to turn on graphics acceleration in Win2K3 Server. it's off by default (unlike XP) and it will be LOUSY to use until you do tools and enable it.
oh then never mind. XP just needs the tools.
